accommodations.description: An unordered collection of StudentAssessmentAccommodations. The specific type of special variation used in how an examination is presented, how it is administered, or how the test taker is allowed to respond. This generally refers to changes that do not substantially alter what the examination measures. The proper use of accommodations does not substantially change academic level or performance criteria. For example:          Braille          Enlarged monitor view          Extra time          Large Print          Setting          Oral Administration          ...

administrationDate.description: The date and time an Assessment was completed by the Student. The use of ISO-8601 formats with a timezone designator (UTC or time offset) is recommended in order to prevent ambiguity due to time zones.

administrationEndDate.description: The date and time an Assessment administration ended.

administrationEnvironmentDescriptor.description: The environment in which the test was administered. For example:          Electronic          Classroom          Testing Center          ...

administrationLanguageDescriptor.description: The language in which an Assessment is written and/or administered.

eventCircumstanceDescriptor.description: An unusual event occurred during the administration of the Assessment. This could include fire alarm, Student became ill, etc.

eventDescription.description: Describes special events that occur before during or after the Assessment Session that may impact use of results.

items.description: An unordered collection of StudentAssessmentItems. The Student's response to an Assessment item and the item-level scores such as correct, incorrect, or met standard.

reasonNotTestedDescriptor.description: The primary reason Student is not tested. For example:          Absent          Refusal by Parent          Refusal by Student          Medical waiver          Illness          Disruptive behavior          LEP Exempt          ...

InterventionEffectivenessRatingDescripto.description: An Intervention demonstrates effectiveness if the research has shown that the Program caused an improvement in outcomes. Values: positive effects, potentially positive effects, mixed effects, potentially negative effects, negative effects, and no discernible effects.

improvementIndex.description: Along a percentile distribution of Students, the improvement index represents the change in an average Student's percentile rank that is considered to be due to the Intervention.

continuationOfServicesReasonDescriptor.description: The "continuation of services" provision found in Section 1304(e) of the statute provides that (1) a child who ceases to be a migratory child during a School term shall be eligible for services until the end of such term; (2) a child who is no longer a migratory child may continue to receive services for one additional School year, but only if comparable services are not available through other Programs; and (3) secondary School Students who were eligible for services in secondary School may continue to be served through credit accrual Programs until graduation. Only Students who received services at any time during their 36 month eligibility period may continue to receive services (not necessarily the same service).

eligibilityExpirationDate.description: The Eligibility Expiration Date is used to determine end of eligibility and to Account for a child's eligibility expiring earlier than 36 months from the child's QAD. A child's eligibility would end earlier than 36 months from the child's QAD, if the child is no longer entitled to a free public education (e.g., graduated with a high School diploma, obtained a high School equivalency diploma (HSED), or for other reasons as determined by States' requirements), or if the child passes away.

endDate.description: The month, day, and year on which the Student exited the Program or stopped receiving services.

lastQualifyingMove.description: Date the last qualifying move occurred; used to compute MEP status.

migrantEducationProgramServices.description: An unordered collection of StudentMigrantEducationProgramAssociationMigrantEducationProgramServices. Indicates the Service(s) being provided to the Student by the Migrant Education Program.

priorityForServices.description: Report migratory children who are classified as having "priority for services" because they are failing, or most at risk of failing to meet the State's challenging State academic content standards and challenging State Student academic achievement standards, and their education has been interrupted during the regular School year.

qualifyingArrivalDate.description: The Qualifying Arrival Date (QAD) is the date the child joins the worker who has already moved, or the date when the worker joins the child who has already moved. The QAD is the date that the child's eligibility for the MEP begins. The QAD is not affected by subsequent non-qualifying moves.

href.description: The URL to the related resource.

Created.description: The resource was created.  An ETag value is available in the ETag header, and the Location of the resource is available in the Location header of the response.

Updated.description: The resource was updated.  An updated ETag value is available in the ETag header of the response.

NotModified.description: The resource's current server-side ETag value matched the If-None-Match header value supplied with the request indicating the resource has not been modified.

BadRequest.description: Bad Request. The request was invalid and cannot be completed. See the response body for specific validation errors. This will typically be an issue with the query parameters or their values.

Unauthorized.description: Unauthorized. The request requires authentication. The OAuth bearer token was either not provided or is invalid. The operation may succeed once authentication has been successfully completed.

Forbidden.description: Forbidden. The request cannot be completed in the current authorization context. Contact your administrator if you believe this operation should be allowed.

NotFound.description: The resource could not be found.

Conflict.description: Conflict.  The request cannot be completed because it would result in an invalid state.  See the response body for details.

PreconditionFailed.description: The resource's current server-side ETag value does not match the supplied If-Match header value in the request. This indicates the resource has been modified by another consumer.

Error.description: An unhandled error occurred on the server. See the response body for details.

offset.name: offset
offset.description: Indicates how many items should be skipped before returning results.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Indicates the maximum number of items that should be returned in the results.

MinChangeVersion.name: minChangeVersion
MinChangeVersion.description: Used in synchronization to set sequence minimum ChangeVersion

MaxChangeVersion.name: maxChangeVersion
MaxChangeVersion.description: Used in synchronization to set sequence maximum ChangeVersion

If-None-Match.name: If-None-Match
If-None-Match.description: The previously returned ETag header value, used here to prevent the unnecessary data transfer of an unchanged resource.

id.name: id
id.description: A resource identifier that uniquely identifies the resource.

fields.name: fields
fields.description: Specifies a subset of properties that should be returned for each entity (e.g. "property1,collection1(collProp1,collProp2)").

queryExpression.name: q
queryExpression.description: Specifies a query filter expression for the request. Currently only supports range-based queries on dates and numbers (e.g. "[2016-03-07..2016-03-10]").

totalCount.name: totalCount
totalCount.description: Indicates if the total number of items available should be returned in the 'Total-Count' header of the response.  If set to false, 'Total-Count' header will not be provided.

oauth2_client_Credentials.description: Ed-Fi ODS/API OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials Grant Type authorization

info.title: Ed-Fi Operational Data Store API
info.description:
The Ed-Fi ODS / API enables applications to read and write education data stored in an Ed-Fi ODS through a secure REST interface. The Ed-Fi ODS / API supports both transactional and bulk modes of operation. 
***
 > *Note: Consumers of ODS / API information should sanitize all data for display and storage. The ODS / API provides reasonable safeguards against cross-site scripting attacks and other malicious content, but the platform does not and cannot guarantee that the data it contains is free of all potentially harmful content.* 
***

get.summary: Retrieves specific resources using the resource's property values (using the "Get" pattern).
get.description: This GET operation provides access to resources using the "Get" search pattern.  The values of any properties of the resource that are specified will be used to return all matching results (if it exists).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Indicates how many items should be skipped before returning results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Indicates the maximum number of items that should be returned in the results.

parameters.name: totalCount
parameters.description: Indicates if the total number of items available should be returned in the 'Total-Count' header of the response.  If set to false, 'Total-Count' header will not be provided.

parameters.name: weekIdentifier
parameters.description: The School label for the week.

parameters.name: SchoolId
parameters.description: The identifier assigned to a School.

parameters.name: beginDate
parameters.description: The start date for the academic week.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date for the academic week.

parameters.name: totalInstructionalDays
parameters.description: The total instructional days during the academic week.

200.description: The requested resource was successfully retrieved.

304.description: The resource's current server-side ETag value matched the If-None-Match header value supplied with the request indicating the resource has not been modified.

400.description: Bad Request. The request was invalid and cannot be completed. See the response body for specific validation errors. This will typically be an issue with the query parameters or their values.

401.description: Unauthorized. The request requires authentication. The OAuth bearer token was either not provided or is invalid. The operation may succeed once authentication has been successfully completed.

403.description: Forbidden. The request cannot be completed in the current authorization context. Contact your administrator if you believe this operation should be allowed.

404.description: The resource could not be found.

500.description: An unhandled error occurred on the server. See the response body for details.

post.summary: Creates or updates resources based on the natural key values of the supplied resource.
post.description: The POST operation can be used to create or update resources. In database terms, this is often referred to as an "upsert" operation (insert + update). Clients should NOT include the resource "id" in the JSON body because it will result in an error (you must use a PUT operation to update a resource by "id"). The web service will identify whether the resource already exists based on the natural key values provided, and update or create the resource appropriately.

201.description: The resource was created.  An ETag value is available in the ETag header, and the Location of the resource is available in the Location header of the response.

204.description: The resource was updated.  An updated ETag value is available in the ETag header of the response.

400.description: Bad Request. The request was invalid and cannot be completed. See the response body for specific validation errors. This will typically be an issue with the query parameters or their values.

401.description: Unauthorized. The request requires authentication. The OAuth bearer token was either not provided or is invalid. The operation may succeed once authentication has been successfully completed.

403.description: Forbidden. The request cannot be completed in the current authorization context. Contact your administrator if you believe this operation should be allowed.

409.description: Conflict.  The request cannot be completed because it would result in an invalid state.  See the response body for details.

412.description: The resource's current server-side ETag value does not match the supplied If-Match header value in the request. This indicates the resource has been modified by another consumer.

500.description: An unhandled error occurred on the server. See the response body for details.

get.summary: Retrieves a specific resource using the resource's identifier (using the "Get By Id" pattern).
get.description: This GET operation retrieves a resource by the specified resource identifier.

parameters.name: id

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description: The previously returned ETag header value, used here to prevent the unnecessary data transfer of an unchanged resource.

304.description: The resource's current server-side ETag value matched the If-None-Match header value supplied with the request indicating the resource has not been modified.

put.summary: Updates or creates a resource based on the resource identifier.
put.description: The PUT operation is used to update or create a resource by identifier. If the resource doesn't exist, the resource will be created using that identifier. Additionally, natural key values cannot be changed using this operation, and will not be modified in the database.  If the resource "id" is provided in the JSON body, it will be ignored as well.

404.description: The resource could not be found.

409.description: Conflict.  The request cannot be completed because it would result in an invalid state.  See the response body for details.

412.description: The resource's current server-side ETag value does not match the supplied If-Match header value in the request. This indicates the resource has been modified by another consumer.

500.description: An unhandled error occurred on the server. See the response body for details.

parameters.name: CourseCode
parameters.description: A unique alphanumeric code assigned to a Course.

parameters.name: educationOrganizationId
parameters.description: The identifier assigned to an education organization.

parameters.name: academicSubjectDescriptor
parameters.description: The intended major subject area of the Course.

parameters.name: careerPathwayDescriptor
parameters.description: Indicates the career cluster or pathway the Course is associated with as part of a CTE curriculum.

parameters.name: CourseDefinedByDescriptor
parameters.description: Specifies whether the Course was defined by the SEA, LEA, School, or national organization.

parameters.name: CourseGPAApplicabilityDescriptor
parameters.description: An indicator of whether or not the Course being described is included in the computation of the Student's Grade Point Average, and if so, if it is weighted differently from regular Courses.

parameters.name: minimumAvailableCreditTypeDescriptor
parameters.description: The type of credits or units of value awarded for the completion of a Course.

parameters.name: maximumAvailableCreditTypeDescriptor
parameters.description: The type of credits or units of value awarded for the completion of a Course.

parameters.name: CourseDescription
parameters.description: A description of the content standards and goals covered in the Course. Reference may be made to state or national content standards.

parameters.name: CourseTitle
parameters.description: The descriptive name given to a Course of study offered in a School or other institution or organization. In departmentalized classes at the elementary, secondary, and postsecondary levels (and for Staff development activities), this refers to the name by which a Course is identified (e.g., American History, English III). For elementary and other non-departmentalized classes, it refers to any portion of the instruction for which a Grade or report is assigned (e.g., reading, composition, spelling, and language arts).

parameters.name: dateCourseAdopted
parameters.description: Date the Course was adopted by the education agency.

parameters.name: highSchoolCourseRequirement
parameters.description: An indication that this Course may satisfy high School graduation requirements in the Course's subject area.

parameters.name: maxCompletionsForCredit
parameters.description: Designates how many times the Course may be taken with credit received by the Student.

parameters.name: maximumAvailableCreditConversion
parameters.description: Conversion factor that when multiplied by the number of credits is equivalent to Carnegie units.

parameters.name: maximumAvailableCredits
parameters.description: The value of credits or units of value awarded for the completion of a Course.

parameters.name: minimumAvailableCreditConversion
parameters.description: Conversion factor that when multiplied by the number of credits is equivalent to Carnegie units.

parameters.name: minimumAvailableCredits
parameters.description: The value of credits or units of value awarded for the completion of a Course.

parameters.name: numberOfParts
parameters.description: The number of parts identified for a Course.

parameters.name: timeRequiredForCompletion
parameters.description: The Actual or estimated number of clock minutes required for class completion.  This number is especially important for career and technical education classes and may represent (in minutes) the clock hour requirement of the class.

parameters.description: The type of credits or units of value awarded for the completion of a Course.

parameters.description: The type of credits or units of value awarded for the completion of a Course.

parameters.description: The method the credits were earned (e.g., Classroom, Examination, Transfer).

parameters.name: attemptedCreditConversion
parameters.description: Conversion factor that when multiplied by the number of credits is equivalent to Carnegie units.

parameters.name: attemptedCredits
parameters.description: The value of credits or units of value awarded for the completion of a Course.

parameters.name: CourseTitle
parameters.description: The descriptive name given to a Course of study offered in a School or other institution or organization. In departmentalized classes at the elementary, secondary, and postsecondary levels (and for Staff development activities), this refers to the name by which a Course is identified (e.g., American History, English III). For elementary and other non-departmentalized classes, it refers to any portion of the instruction for which a Grade or report is assigned (e.g., reading, composition, spelling, language arts).

parameters.name: earnedCreditConversion
parameters.description: Conversion factor that when multiplied by the number of credits is equivalent to Carnegie units.

parameters.name: earnedCredits
parameters.description: The value of credits or units of value awarded for the completion of a Course.

parameters.name: finalLetterGradeEarned
parameters.description: The final indicator of Student performance in a class as submitted by the instructor.

parameters.name: finalNumericGradeEarned
parameters.description: The final indicator of Student performance in a class as submitted by the instructor.

parameters.description: Indicates how many items should be skipped before returning results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Indicates the maximum number of items that should be returned in the results.

parameters.name: totalCount
parameters.description: Indicates if the total number of items available should be returned in the 'Total-Count' header of the response.  If set to false, 'Total-Count' header will not be provided.

parameters.name: incidentIdentifier
parameters.description: A locally assigned unique identifier (within the School or School district) to identify each specific DisciplineIncident or occurrence. The same identifier should be used to document the entire DisciplineIncident even if it included multiple offenses and multiple offenders.

parameters.name: SchoolId
parameters.description: The identifier assigned to a School.

parameters.name: StaffUniqueId
parameters.description: A unique alphanumeric code assigned to a Staff.

parameters.name: incidentLocationDescriptor
parameters.description: Identifies where the DisciplineIncident occurred and whether or not it occurred on School, for example:          On School          Administrative offices area          Cafeteria area          Classroom          Hallway or stairs          ...

parameters.name: reporterDescriptionDescriptor
parameters.description: Information on the type of individual who reported the DisciplineIncident. When known and/or if useful, use a more specific option code (e.g., "Counselor" rather than "Professional Staff"); for example:          Student          Parent/guardian          Law enforcement officer          NonSchool personnel          Representative of visiting School          ...

parameters.name: caseNumber
parameters.description: The case number assigned to the DisciplineIncident by law enforcement or other organization.

parameters.name: incidentCost
parameters.description: The value of any quantifiable monetary loss directly resulting from the DisciplineIncident. Examples include the value of repairs necessitated by vandalism of a School facility, or the value of personnel resources used for repairs or consumed by the incident.

parameters.name: incidentDate
parameters.description: The month, day, and year on which the DisciplineIncident occurred.

parameters.name: incidentDescription
parameters.description: The description for an incident.

parameters.name: incidentTime
parameters.description: An indication of the time of day the incident took place.

parameters.name: reportedToLawEnforcement
parameters.description: Indicator of whether the incident was reported to law enforcement.

parameters.name: reporterName
parameters.description: Identifies the reporter of the DisciplineIncident by name.

parameters.name: contentIdentifier

parameters.name: LearningStandardId
parameters.description: The identifier for the specific learning standard (e.g., 111.15.3.1.A).

parameters.name: contentClassDescriptor
parameters.description: The predominate type or kind characterizing the learning resource.

parameters.name: costRateDescriptor
parameters.description: The rate by which the cost applies.

parameters.name: interactivityStyleDescriptor
parameters.description: The predominate mode of learning supported by the learning resource. Acceptable values are active, expositive, or mixed.

parameters.name: additionalAuthorsIndicator
parameters.description: Indicates whether there are additional un-named authors. In a research report, this is often marked by the abbreviation "et al".

parameters.name: cost
parameters.description: An amount that has to be paid or spent to buy or obtain the EducationContent.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: An extended written representation of the education content.

parameters.name: learningResourceMetadataURI
parameters.description: The URI (typical a URL) pointing to the metadata entry in a LRMI metadata repository, which describes this content item.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace for the EducationContent.

parameters.name: publicationDate
parameters.description: The date on which this content was first published.

parameters.name: publicationYear
parameters.description: The year at which this content was first published.

parameters.name: publisher
parameters.description: The organization credited with publishing the resource.

parameters.name: shortDescription
parameters.description: A short description or name of the entity.

parameters.name: timeRequired
parameters.description: Approximate or typical time it takes to work with or through this learning resource for the typical intended target audience.

parameters.name: useRightsURL
parameters.description: The URL where the owner specifies permissions for using the resource.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version identifier for the content.

parameters.description: A resource identifier that uniquely identifies the resource.

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description: The previously returned ETag header value, used here to prevent the unnecessary data transfer of an unchanged resource.

200.description: The requested resource was successfully retrieved.

304.description: The resource's current server-side ETag value matched the If-None-Match header value supplied with the request indicating the resource has not been modified.

400.description: Bad Request. The request was invalid and cannot be completed. See the response body for specific validation errors. This will typically be an issue with the query parameters or their values.

401.description: Unauthorized. The request requires authentication. The OAuth bearer token was either not provided or is invalid. The operation may succeed once authentication has been successfully completed.

403.description: Forbidden. The request cannot be completed in the current authorization context. Contact your administrator if you believe this operation should be allowed.

404.description: The resource could not be found.

500.description: An unhandled error occurred on the server. See the response body for details.

put.summary: Updates or creates a resource based on the resource identifier.
put.description: The PUT operation is used to update or create a resource by identifier. If the resource doesn't exist, the resource will be created using that identifier. Additionally, natural key values cannot be changed using this operation, and will not be modified in the database.  If the resource "id" is provided in the JSON body, it will be ignored as well.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A resource identifier that uniquely identifies the resource.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The ETag header value used to prevent the PUT from updating a resource modified by another consumer.

204.description: The resource was updated.  An updated ETag value is available in the ETag header of the response.

400.description: Bad Request. The request was invalid and cannot be completed. See the response body for specific validation errors. This will typically be an issue with the query parameters or their values.

401.description: Unauthorized. The request requires authentication. The OAuth bearer token was either not provided or is invalid. The operation may succeed once authentication has been successfully completed.

403.description: Forbidden. The request cannot be completed in the current authorization context. Contact your administrator if you believe this operation should be allowed.

404.description: The resource could not be found.

409.description: Conflict.  The request cannot be completed because it would result in an invalid state.  See the response body for details.

412.description: The resource's current server-side ETag value does not match the supplied If-Match header value in the request. This indicates the resource has been modified by another consumer.

500.description: An unhandled error occurred on the server. See the response body for details.

delete.summary: Deletes an existing resource using the resource identifier.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A resource identifier that uniquely identifies the resource.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The ETag header value used to prevent the DELETE from removing a resource modified by another consumer.

204.description: The resource was successfully deleted.

400.description: Bad Request. The request was invalid and cannot be completed. See the response body for specific validation errors. This will typically be an issue with the query parameters or their values.

401.description: Unauthorized. The request requires authentication. The OAuth bearer token was either not provided or is invalid. The operation may succeed once authentication has been successfully completed.

get.summary: Retrieves specific resources using the resource's property values (using the "Get" pattern).
get.description: This GET operation provides access to resources using the "Get" search pattern.  The values of any properties of the resource that are specified will be used to return all matching results (if it exists).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Indicates how many items should be skipped before returning results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Indicates the maximum number of items that should be returned in the results.

parameters.name: totalCount
parameters.description: Indicates if the total number of items available should be returned in the 'Total-Count' header of the response.  If set to false, 'Total-Count' header will not be provided.

parameters.name: beginDate
parameters.description: Start date for the association of Staff to this Cohort.

parameters.name: CohortIdentifier
parameters.description: The name or ID for the Cohort.

parameters.name: educationOrganizationId
parameters.description: The identifier assigned to an education organization.

parameters.name: StaffUniqueId
parameters.description: A unique alphanumeric code assigned to a Staff.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date for the association of Staff to this Cohort.

parameters.name: StudentRecordAccess
parameters.description: Indicator of whether the Staff has access to the Student records of the Cohort per district interpretation of FERPA and other privacy laws, regulations, and policies.

Clients should NOT include the resource "id" in the JSON body because it will result in an error (you must use a PUT operation to update a resource by "id"). The web service will identify whether the resource already exists based on the natural key values provided, and update or create the resource appropriately.

201.description: The resource was created.  An ETag value is available in the ETag header, and the Location of the resource is available in the Location header of the response.

204.description: The resource was updated.  An updated ETag value is available in the ETag header of the response.

400.description: Bad Request. The request was invalid and cannot be completed. See the response body for specific validation errors. This will typically be an issue with the query parameters or their values.

401.description: Unauthorized. The request requires authentication. The OAuth bearer token was either not provided or is invalid. The operation may succeed once authentication has been successfully completed.

403.description: Forbidden. The request cannot be completed in the current authorization context. Contact your administrator if you believe this operation should be allowed.

409.description: Conflict.  The request cannot be completed because it would result in an invalid state.  See the response body for details.

412.description: The resource's current server-side ETag value does not match the supplied If-Match header value in the request. This indicates the resource has been modified by another consumer.

500.description: An unhandled error occurred on the server. See the response body for details.

get.summary: Retrieves a specific resource using the resource's identifier (using the "Get By Id" pattern).
get.description: This GET operation retrieves a resource by the specified resource identifier.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A resource identifier that uniquely identifies the resource.

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description: The previously returned ETag header value, used here to prevent the unnecessary data transfer of an unchanged resource.

200.description: The requested resource was successfully retrieved.

304.description: The resource's current server-side ETag value matched the If-None-Match header value supplied with the request indicating the resource has not been modified.

400.description: Bad Request. The request was invalid and cannot be completed. See the response body for specific validation errors. This will typically be an issue with the query parameters or their values.

401.description: Unauthorized. The request requires authentication. The OAuth bearer token was either not provided or is invalid. The operation may succeed once authentication has been successfully completed.

403.description: Forbidden. The request cannot be completed in the current authorization context. Contact your administrator if you believe this operation should be allowed.

404.description: The resource could not be found.

500.description: An unhandled error occurred on the server. See the response body for details.

put.summary: Updates or creates a resource based on the resource identifier.
put.description: The PUT operation is used to update or create a resource by identifier. If the resource doesn't exist, the resource will be created using that identifier. Additionally, natural key values cannot be changed using this operation, and will not be modified in the database.  If the resource "id" is provided in the JSON body, it will be ignored as well.

parameters.name: If-Match

204.description: The resource was updated.  An updated ETag value is available in the ETag header of the response.

400.description: Bad Request. The request was invalid and cannot be completed. See the response body for specific validation errors. This will typically be an issue with the query parameters or their values.

404.description: The resource could not be found.

409.description: Conflict.  The request cannot be completed because it would result in an invalid state.  See the response body for details.

412.description: The resource's current server-side ETag value does not match the supplied If-Match header value in the request. This indicates the resource has been modified by another consumer.

500.description: An unhandled error occurred on the server. See the response body for details.

get.description: This GET operation provides access to resources using the "Get" search pattern.  The values of any properties of the resource that are specified will be used to return all matching results (if it exists).

parameters.description: The end date of the Staff leave.

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: Expanded reason for the Staff leave.

parameters.name: substituteAssigned
parameters.description: Indicator of whether a substitute was assigned during the period of Staff leave.

parameters.name: localCourseCode
parameters.description: The local code assigned by the School that identifies the Course offering provided for the instruction of Students.

parameters.name: SchoolId
parameters.description: The identifier assigned to a School.

parameters.name: SchoolYear
parameters.description: The identifier for the School year.

parameters.name: SectionIdentifier
parameters.description: The local identifier assigned to a Section.

parameters.name: SessionName
parameters.description: The identifier for the Calendar for the academic Session (e.g., 2010/11, 2011 Summer).

parameters.name: StaffUniqueId
parameters.description: A unique alphanumeric code assigned to a Staff.

parameters.name: classroomPositionDescriptor
parameters.description: The type of position the Staff member holds in the specific class/Section; for example:          Teacher of Record, Assistant Teacher, Support Teacher, Substitute Teacher...

parameters.name: beginDate
parameters.description: Month, day, and year of a teacher's assignment to the Section. If blank, defaults to the first day of the first grading period for the Section.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Month, day, and year of the last day of a Staff member's assignment to the Section.

parameters.name: highlyQualifiedTeacher
parameters.description: An indication of whether a teacher is classified as highly qualified for his/her assignment according to state definition. This attribute indicates the teacher is highly qualified for this Section being taught.

parameters.name: percentageContribution
parameters.description: Indicates the percentage of the total scheduled Course time, academic standards, and/or learning activities delivered in this Section by this Staff member. A teacher of record designation may be based solely or partially on this contribution percentage.

parameters.name: teacherStudentDataLinkExclusion
parameters.description: Indicates that the entire Section is excluded from calculation of value-added or growth attribution calculations used for a particular teacher evaluation.

parameters.name: lastSurname
parameters.description: The name borne in common by members of a family.

parameters.name: maidenName

parameters.name: termDescriptor
parameters.description: The term for the Session during the School year.

parameters.name: educationOrganizationId
parameters.description: The identifier assigned to an education organization.

parameters.name: SchoolYear
parameters.description: The identifier for the School year.

parameters.name: StudentUniqueId
parameters.description: A unique alphanumeric code assigned to a Student.

parameters.name: cumulativeEarnedCreditTypeDescriptor
parameters.description: The type of credits or units of value awarded for the completion of a Course.

parameters.name: cumulativeAttemptedCreditTypeDescriptor
parameters.description: The type of credits or units of value awarded for the completion of a Course.

parameters.name: SessionEarnedCreditTypeDescriptor
parameters.description: The type of credits or units of value awarded for the completion of a Course.

parameters.name: SessionAttemptedCreditTypeDescriptor
parameters.description: The type of credits or units of value awarded for the completion of a Course.

parameters.name: cumulativeAttemptedCreditConversion
parameters.description: Conversion factor that when multiplied by the number of credits is equivalent to Carnegie units.

parameters.name: cumulativeAttemptedCredits
parameters.description: The value of credits or units of value awarded for the completion of a Course.

parameters.name: cumulativeEarnedCreditConversion
parameters.description: Conversion factor that when multiplied by the number of credits is equivalent to Carnegie units.

parameters.name: cumulativeEarnedCredits
parameters.description: The value of credits or units of value awarded for the completion of a Course.

parameters.name: cumulativeGradePointAverage
parameters.description: A measure of average performance in all Courses taken by an individual during his or her School career as determined for record-keeping purposes. This is obtained by dividing the total Grade points received by the total number of credits attempted. This usually includes Grade points received and credits attempted in his or her current School as well as those transferred from Schools in which the individual was previously enrolled.

parameters.name: cumulativeGradePointsEarned
parameters.description: The cumulative number of Grade points an individual earns by successfully completing Courses or examinations during his or her enrollment in the current School as well as those transferred from Schools in which the individual had been previously enrolled.

parameters.name: GradeValueQualifier
parameters.description: The scale of equivalents, if applicable, for Grades awarded as indicators of performance in Schoolwork. For example, numerical equivalents for letter Grades used in determining a Student's Grade Point Average (A=4, B=3, C=2, D=1 in a four-point system) or letter equivalents for percentage Grades (90-100%=A, 80-90%=B, etc.)

parameters.name: projectedGraduationDate
parameters.description: The month and year the Student is projected to graduate.

parameters.name: SessionAttemptedCreditConversion
parameters.description: Conversion factor that when multiplied by the number of credits is equivalent to Carnegie units.

parameters.name: SessionAttemptedCredits
parameters.description: The value of credits or units of value awarded for the completion of a Course.

parameters.name: SessionEarnedCreditConversion
parameters.description: Conversion factor that when multiplied by the number of credits is equivalent to Carnegie units.

parameters.name: SessionEarnedCredits
parameters.description: The value of credits or units of value awarded for the completion of a Course.

parameters.name: SessionGradePointAverage
parameters.description: The Grade point average for an individual computed as the Grade points earned during the Session divided by the number of credits attempted.

parameters.name: SessionGradePointsEarned
parameters.description: The number of Grade points an individual earned for this Session.

parameters.name: StudentAssessmentIdentifier
parameters.description: A unique number or alphanumeric code assigned to an Assessment administered to a Student.

parameters.description: A unique number or alphanumeric code assigned to an Assessment.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Namespace for the Assessment.

parameters.name: StudentUniqueId
parameters.description: A unique alphanumeric code assigned to a Student.

parameters.name: SchoolYear
parameters.description: The School year for which the Assessment was administered to a Student. Among other uses, handles cases in which a Student takes a prior-year exam in a subsequent School year during an exam re-test.

parameters.description: The environment in which the test was administered. For example:          Electronic          Classroom          Testing Center          ...

parameters.name: eventCircumstanceDescriptor

parameters.name: whenAssessedGradeLevelDescriptor
parameters.description: The Grade level of a Student when assessed.

parameters.name: administrationLanguageDescriptor
parameters.description: The language in which an Assessment is written and/or administered.

parameters.name: reasonNotTestedDescriptor
parameters.description: The primary reason Student is not tested. For example:          Absent          Refusal by Parent          Refusal by Student          Medical waiver          Illness          Disruptive behavior          LEP Exempt          ...

parameters.name: retestIndicatorDescriptor
parameters.description: Indicator if the test was retaken. For example:          Primary administration          First retest          Second retest          ...

parameters.name: administrationDate
parameters.description: The date and time an Assessment was completed by the Student. The use of ISO-8601 formats with a timezone designator (UTC or time offset) is recommended in order to prevent ambiguity due to time zones.

parameters.name: administrationEndDate
parameters.description: The date and time an Assessment administration ended.

parameters.name: eventDescription
parameters.description: Describes special events that occur before during or after the Assessment Session that may impact use of results.

parameters.name: serialNumber
parameters.description: The unique number for the Assessment form or answer document.

parameters.name: beginDate
parameters.description: The month, day, and year on which the Student first received services.

parameters.name: educationOrganizationId
parameters.description: The identifier assigned to an education organization.

parameters.name: ProgramEducationOrganizationId
parameters.description: The identifier assigned to an education organization.

parameters.name: ProgramName
parameters.description: The formal name of the Program of instruction, training, services, or benefits available through federal, state, or local agencies.

parameters.name: ProgramTypeDescriptor
parameters.description: The type of Program.

parameters.name: StudentUniqueId
parameters.description: A unique alphanumeric code assigned to a Student.

parameters.name: continuationOfServicesReasonDescriptor
parameters.description: The "continuation of services" provision found in Section 1304(e) of the statute provides that (1) a child who ceases to be a migratory child during a School term shall be eligible for services until the end of such term; (2) a child who is no longer a migratory child may continue to receive services for one additional School year, but only if comparable services are not available through other Programs; and (3) secondary School Students who were eligible for services in secondary School may continue to be served through credit accrual Programs until graduation. Only Students who received services at any time during their 36 month eligibility period may continue to receive services (not necessarily the same service).

parameters.name: eligibilityExpirationDate
parameters.description: The Eligibility Expiration Date is used to determine end of eligibility and to Account for a child's eligibility expiring earlier than 36 months from the child's QAD. A child's eligibility would end earlier than 36 months from the child's QAD, if the child is no longer entitled to a free public education (e.g., graduated with a high School diploma, obtained a high School equivalency diploma (HSED), or for other reasons as determined by States' requirements), or if the child passes away.

parameters.name: lastQualifyingMove
parameters.description: Date the last qualifying move occurred; used to compute MEP status.

parameters.name: priorityForServices
parameters.description: Report migratory children who are classified as having "priority for services" because they are failing, or most at risk of failing to meet the State's challenging State academic content standards and challenging State Student academic achievement standards, and their education has been interrupted during the regular School year.

parameters.name: qualifyingArrivalDate
parameters.description: The Qualifying Arrival Date (QAD) is the date the child joins the worker who has already moved, or the date when the worker joins the child who has already moved. The QAD is the date that the child's eligibility for the MEP begins. The QAD is not affected by subsequent non-qualifying moves.

parameters.name: stateResidencyDate
parameters.description: The verified State residency for the Student.

parameters.name: usInitialEntry
parameters.description: The month, day, and year on which the Student first entered the U.S.

parameters.name: usInitialSchoolEntry
parameters.description: The month, day, and year on which the Student first entered a U.S. School.

parameters.name: usMostRecentEntry
parameters.description: The month, day, and year of the Student's most recent entry into the U.S.

parameters.name: entryDate
parameters.description: The month, day, and year on which an individual enters and begins to receive instructional services in a School.

parameters.name: SchoolId
parameters.description: The identifier assigned to a School.

parameters.name: StudentUniqueId
parameters.description: A unique alphanumeric code assigned to a Student.

parameters.name: CalendarCode
parameters.description: The identifier for the Calendar.

parameters.name: SchoolYear
parameters.description: The School year associated with the Student's enrollment.

parameters.name: educationOrganizationId
parameters.description: The identifier assigned to an education organization.

parameters.name: GraduationPlanTypeDescriptor
parameters.description: The type of academic plan the Student is following for graduation: for example, Minimum, Recommended, Distinguished, or Standard.

parameters.name: graduationSchoolYear
parameters.description: The School year the Student is expected to graduate.

parameters.name: classOfSchoolYear
parameters.description: Projected High School graduation year.

parameters.name: entryGradeLevelReasonDescriptor
parameters.description: The primary reason as to why a Staff member determined that a Student should be promoted or not (or be demoted) at the end of a given School term.

parameters.name: entryTypeDescriptor
parameters.description: The process by which a Student enters a School during a given academic Session.

parameters.name: exitWithdrawTypeDescriptor
parameters.description: The circumstances under which the Student exited from membership in an educational institution.

parameters.name: entryGradeLevelDescriptor
parameters.description: The Grade level or primary instructional level at which a Student enters and receives services in a School or an educational institution during a given academic Session.

parameters.name: residencyStatusDescriptor
parameters.description: An indication of the Location of a persons legal residence relative to (within or outside of) the boundaries of the public School attended and its administrative unit.

parameters.name: employedWhileEnrolled
parameters.description: An individual who is a paid employee or works in his or her own business, profession, or farm and at the same time is enrolled in secondary, postsecondary, or adult education.

parameters.name: exitWithdrawDate
parameters.description: The month, day, and year of the first day after the date of an individual's last attendance at a School (if known), the day on which an individual graduated, or the date on which it becomes known officially that an individual left School.

parameters.name: primarySchool
parameters.description: Indicates if a given enrollment record should be considered the primary record for a Student.

parameters.name: repeatGradeIndicator
parameters.description: An indicator of whether the Student is enrolling to repeat a Grade level, either by failure or an agreement to hold the Student back.

parameters.name: SchoolChoiceTransfer
parameters.description: An indication of whether Students transferred in or out of the School did so during the School year under the provisions for public School choice in accordance with Title I, Part A, Section 1116.

get.summary: Retrieves specific resources using the resource's property values (using the "Get" pattern).
get.description: This GET operation provides access to resources using the "Get" search pattern.  The values of any properties of the resource that are specified will be used to return all matching results (if it exists).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Indicates how many items should be skipped before returning results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Indicates the maximum number of items that should be returned in the results.

parameters.name: totalCount
parameters.description: Indicates if the total number of items available should be returned in the 'Total-Count' header of the response.  If set to false, 'Total-Count' header will not be provided.

parameters.name: beginDate
parameters.description: The month, day, and year on which the Student first received services.

parameters.name: educationOrganizationId
parameters.description: The identifier assigned to an education organization.

parameters.name: ProgramEducationOrganizationId
parameters.description: The identifier assigned to an education organization.

parameters.name: ProgramName
parameters.description: The formal name of the Program of instruction, training, services, or benefits available through federal, state, or local agencies.

parameters.name: ProgramTypeDescriptor
parameters.description: The type of Program.

parameters.name: StudentUniqueId
parameters.description: A unique alphanumeric code assigned to a Student.

parameters.name: specialEducationSettingDescriptor
parameters.description: The major instructional setting (more than 50 percent of a Student's special education Program).

parameters.name: ideaEligibility
parameters.description: Indicator of the eligibility of the Student to receive special education services according to the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA).

parameters.name: iepBeginDate
parameters.description: The effective date of the most recent IEP.

parameters.name: iepEndDate
parameters.description: The end date of the most recent IEP.

parameters.name: iepReviewDate
parameters.description: The date of the last IEP review.

parameters.name: lastEvaluationDate
parameters.description: The date of the last special education evaluation.

parameters.name: medicallyFragile
parameters.description: Indicates whether the Student receiving special education and related services is:          1) in the age range of birth to 22 years, and          2) has a serious, ongoing illness or a chronic condition that has lasted or is anticipated to last at least 12 or more months or has required at least one month of hospitalization, and that requires daily, ongoing medical treatments and monitoring by appropriately trained personnel which may include Parents or other family members, and          3) requires the routine use of medical device or of assistive technology to compensate for the loss of usefulness of a body function needed to participate in activities of daily living, and          4) lives with ongoing threat to his or her continued well-being.          Aligns with federal requirements.

parameters.name: multiplyDisabled
parameters.description: Indicates whether the Student receiving special education and related services has been designated as multiply disabled by the admission, review, and dismissal committee as aligned with federal requirements.

parameters.name: SchoolHoursPerWeek
parameters.description: Indicate the total number of hours of instructional time per week for the School that the Student attends.

parameters.name: specialEducationHoursPerWeek
parameters.description: The number of hours per week for special education instruction and therapy.

tags.name: AcademicWeeks
tags.description: This entity represents the academic weeks for a School year, optionally captured to support analyses.

tags.name: AccountabilityRatings
tags.description: An Accountability rating for a School or district.

tags.name: AccountCodes
tags.description: The set of Account codes defined by an education organization for a fiscal year.

tags.name: Accounts
tags.description: This financial entity represents a funding source combined with its purpose and type of transaction. It provides a formal record of the debits and credits relating to the specific Account.

tags.name: Actuals
tags.description: This financial entity represents the sum of the financial transactions to date relating to a specific Account.

tags.name: applicants
tags.description: This entity represents an individual who has applied for a position with any public or private education institution or agency.

tags.name: AssessmentItems
tags.description: This entity represents one of many single measures that make up an Assessment.

tags.name: Assessments
tags.description: This entity represents a tool, instrument, process, or exhibition composed of a systematic sampling of behavior for measuring a Student's competence, knowledge, skills, or behavior. An Assessment can be used to measure differences in individuals or groups and changes in performance from one occasion to the next.

tags.name: BellSchedules
tags.description: This entity represents the schedule of class period meeting times.

tags.name: Budgets
tags.description: This financial entity represents the amount of monies allocated to be spent or received by an education organization as related to a specific Account.

tags.name: CalendarDates
tags.description: The type of scheduled or unscheduled event for the day.

tags.name: Calendars
tags.description: A set of dates associated with an organization.

tags.name: ClassPeriods
tags.description: This entity represents the designation of a regularly scheduled series of class meetings at designated times and days of the week.

tags.name: Cohorts
tags.description: This entity represents any type of list of designated Students for tracking, analysis, or Intervention.

tags.name: CommunityOrganizations
tags.description: This entity represents an administrative unit at the state level which exists primarily to operate local community providers.

tags.name: CommunityProviderLicenses
tags.description: The legal document held by the CommunityProvider that authorizes the holder to perform certain functions and or services.

tags.name: CommunityProviders
tags.description: This entity represents an educational organization that includes Staff and Students who participate in classes and educational activity groups.

tags.name: CompetencyObjectives
tags.description: This entity holds additional competencies for Student achievement that are not associated with specific learning objectives (e.g., paying attention in class).

tags.name: ContractedStaffs
tags.description: This financial entity represents the sum of the financial transactions to date for contracted Staff. ContractedStaff includes "contractors" or "consultants" who perform services for an agreed upon fee, or an employee of a management service contracted to work on site.

tags.name: CourseOfferings
tags.description: This entity represents an entry in the Course catalog of available Courses offered by the School during a Session.

tags.name: Courses
tags.description: This educational entity represents the organization of subject matter and related learning experiences provided for the instruction of Students on a regular or systematic basis.

tags.name: CourseTranscripts
tags.description: This entity is the final record of a Student's performance in their Courses at the end of a semester or School year.

tags.name: Credentials
tags.description: The legal document giving authorization to perform teaching assignment services.

tags.name: DisciplineActions
tags.description: This event entity represents actions taken by an education organization after a disruptive event that is recorded as a discipline incident.

tags.name: DisciplineIncidents
tags.description: This event entity represents an occurrence of an infraction ranging from a minor behavioral problem that disrupts the orderly functioning of a School or classroom (such as tardiness) to a criminal act that results in the involvement of a law enforcement official (such as robbery). A single event (e.g., a fight) is one incident regardless of how many perpetrators or victims are involved. Discipline incidents are events classified as warranting discipline action.

tags.name: EducationContents
tags.description: This entity represents materials for Students or teachers that can be used for teaching, learning, research, and more. Education content includes full Courses, Course materials, modules, Intervention descriptions, textbooks, streaming videos, tests, software, and any other tools, materials, or techniques used to support access to knowledge.

tags.name: EducationOrganizationInterventionPrescriptionAssociations
tags.description: This association indicates Interventions made available by an education organization. Often, a district-level education organization purchases a set of Intervention prescriptions and makes them available to its Schools for use on demand.

tags.name: EducationOrganizationNetworkAssociations
tags.description: Properties of the association between the EducationOrganization and its network(s).

tags.name: EducationOrganizationNetworks
tags.description: This entity is a self-organized membership network of peer-level education organizations intended to provide shared services or collective procurement.

tags.name: EducationOrganizationPeerAssociations
tags.description: The association from an education organization to its peers.

tags.name: EducationServiceCenters
tags.description: This entity represents a regional, multi-services public agency authorized by state law to develop, manage and provide services, Programs, or other support options (e.g., construction, food services, and technology services) to LEAs.

tags.name: FeederSchoolAssociations
tags.description: The association from feeder School to the receiving School.

tags.name: GradebookEntries
tags.description: This entity represents an assignment, homework, or classroom Assessment to be recorded in a Gradebook.

tags.name: Grades
tags.description: This educational entity represents an overall score or Assessment tied to a Course over a period of time (i.e., the grading period). Student Grades are usually a compilation of marks and other scores.

tags.name: GradingPeriods
tags.description: This entity represents the time span for which Grades are reported.

tags.name: GraduationPlans
tags.description: This entity is a plan outlining the required credits, credits by subject, credits by Course, and other criteria required for graduation. A graduation plan may be one or more standard plans defined by an education organization and/or individual plans for some or all Students.

tags.name: InterventionPrescriptions
tags.description: This entity represents a formal prescription of an instructional approach focusing on the specific techniques and materials used to teach a given subject. This can be prescribed by academic research, an Interventions vendor, or another entity.

tags.name: Interventions
tags.description: An implementation of an instructional approach focusing on the specific techniques and materials used to teach a given subject.

tags.name: InterventionStudies
tags.description: An experimental or quasi-experimental study of an Intervention technique.

tags.name: LearningObjectives
tags.description: This entity represents identified learning objectives for Courses in specific Grades.

tags.name: LearningStandards
tags.description: This entity is a sub-element of a learning objective consisting of a precise statement of the expectation of a Student's proficiency.

tags.name: localEducationAgencies
tags.description: This entity represents an administrative unit at the local level which exists primarily to operate Schools or to contract for educational services. It includes School districts, charter Schools, charter management organizations, or other local administrative organizations.

tags.name: Locations
tags.description: This entity represents the physical space where Students gather for a particular class/Section. The Location may be an indoor or outdoor area designated for the purpose of meeting the educational needs of Students.

tags.name: ObjectiveAssessments
tags.description: This entity represents subtests that assess specific learning objectives.

tags.name: OpenStaffPositions
tags.description: This entity represents an open Staff position that the education organization is seeking to fill.

tags.name: Parents
tags.description: This entity represents a Parent or guardian of a Student, such as mother, father, or caretaker.

tags.name: Payrolls
tags.description: This financial entity represents the sum of the financial transactions to date for employee compensation. An "employee" who performs services under the direction of the employing institution or agency, is compensated for such services by the employer and is eligible for employee benefits and wage or salary tax withholdings.

tags.name: PostSecondaryEvents
tags.description: This entity captures significant postsecondary events during a Student's high School tenure (e.g., FAFSA application or college application, acceptance, and enrollment) or during a Student's enrollment at a post-secondary institution.

tags.name: PostSecondaryInstitutions
tags.description: An organization that provides educational Programs for individuals who have completed or otherwise left educational Programs in secondary School(s).

tags.name: Programs
tags.description: This entity represents any Program designed to work in conjunction with, or as a supplement to, the main academic Program. Programs may provide instruction, training, services, or benefits through federal, state, or local agencies. Programs may also include organized extracurricular activities for Students.

tags.name: ReportCards
tags.description: This educational entity represents the collection of Student Grades for Courses taken during a grading period.

tags.name: RestraintEvents
tags.description: This event entity represents the instances where a special education Student was physically or mechanically restrained due to imminent serious physical harm to themselves or others, imminent serious property destruction or a combination of both imminent serious physical harm to themselves or others and imminent serious property destruction.

tags.name: Schools
tags.description: This entity represents an educational organization that includes Staff and Students who participate in classes and educational activity groups.

tags.name: SchoolYearTypes
tags.description: Identifier for a School year.

tags.name: SectionAttendanceTakenEvents
tags.description: Captures attendance taken event for given Section.

tags.name: Sections
tags.description: This entity represents a setting in which organized instruction of Course content is provided, in-person or otherwise, to one or more Students for a given period of time. A Course offering may be offered to more than one Section.

tags.name: Sessions
tags.description: A term in the School year, generally a unit of time into which Courses are scheduled, instruction occurs and by which credits are awarded. Sessions may be interrupted by vacations or other events.

tags.name: StaffAbsenceEvents
tags.description: This event entity represents the recording of the dates of Staff absence.

tags.name: StaffCohortAssociations
tags.description: This association indicates the Staff associated with a Cohort of Students.

tags.name: StaffEducationOrganizationAssignmentAssociations
tags.description: This association indicates the education organization to which a Staff member provides services; also known as School of service.

tags.name: StaffEducationOrganizationContactAssociations
tags.description: This association provides the contact information of the Staff associated with the education organization.

tags.name: StaffEducationOrganizationEmploymentAssociations
tags.description: This association indicates the EducationOrganization an employee, contractor, volunteer, or other service provider is formally associated with typically indicated by which organization the Staff member has a services contract with or receives compensation from.

tags.name: StaffLeaves
tags.description: This entity represents the recording of the dates of Staff leave (e.g., sick leave, personal time, vacation).

tags.name: StaffProgramAssociations
tags.description: This association indicates the Staff associated with a Program.

tags.name: Staffs
tags.description:
This entity represents an individual who performs specified activities for any public or private education institution or agency that provides instructional and/or support services to Students or Staff at the early childhood level through high School completion. For example, this includes:
    1. An "employee" who performs services under the direction of the employing institution or agency is compensated for such services by the employer and is eligible for employee benefits and wage or salary tax withholdings
    2. A "contractor" or "consultant" who performs services for an agreed upon fee or an employee of a management service contracted to work on site
    3. A "volunteer" who performs services on a voluntary and uncompensated basis
    4. An in-kind service provider
    5. An independent contractor or businessperson working at a School site.

tags.name: StaffSchoolAssociations
tags.description: This association indicates the School(s) to which a Staff member provides instructional services.

tags.name: StaffSectionAssociations
tags.description: This association indicates the class Sections to which a Staff member is assigned.

tags.name: stateEducationAgencies
tags.description: This entity represents the agency of the state charged with the primary responsibility for coordinating and supervising public instruction, including the setting of standards for elementary and secondary instructional Programs.

tags.name: StudentAcademicRecords
tags.description: This educational entity represents the cumulative record of academic achievement for a Student.

tags.name: StudentAssessments
tags.description: This entity represents the analysis or scoring of a Student's response on an Assessment. The analysis results in a value that represents a Student's performance on a set of items on a test.

tags.name: StudentCohortAssociations
tags.description: This association represents the Cohort(s) for which a Student is designated.

tags.name: StudentCompetencyObjectives
tags.description: This entity represents the competency assessed or evaluated for the Student against a specific learning  objective.

tags.name: StudentCTEProgramAssociations
tags.description: This association represents the career and technical education (CTE) Program that a Student participates in. The association is an extension of the StudentProgramAssociation particular for CTE Programs.

tags.name: StudentDisciplineIncidentAssociations
tags.description: This association indicates those Students who were victims, perpetrators, witnesses, and reporters for a discipline incident.

tags.name: StudentEducationOrganizationAssociations
tags.description: This association represents Student information that is specific to a Student's relationship with an EducationOrganization. Enrollment relationship semantics are covered by StudentSchoolAssociation.

tags.name: StudentEducationOrganizationResponsibilityAssociations
tags.description: This association indicates any relationship between a Student and an education organization other than how the state views enrollment. Enrollment relationship semantics are covered by StudentSchoolAssociation.

tags.name: StudentGradebookEntries
tags.description: This entity holds a Student's Grade or competency level for a Gradebook entry.

tags.name: StudentHomelessProgramAssociations
tags.description: This association represents the McKinney-Vento Homeless Program Program(s) that a Student participates in or from which the Student receives services.

tags.name: StudentInterventionAssociations
tags.description: This association indicates the Students participating in an Intervention.

tags.name: StudentInterventionAttendanceEvents
tags.description: This event entity represents the recording of whether a Student is in attendance for an Intervention service.

tags.name: StudentLanguageInstructionProgramAssociations
tags.description: This association represents the Title III Language Instruction for Limited English Proficient and Immigrant Students Program(s) that a Student participates in or from which the Student receives services.

tags.name: StudentLearningObjectives
tags.description: This entity represents the competency assessed or evaluated for the Student against a specific LearningObjective.

tags.name: StudentMigrantEducationProgramAssociations
tags.description: This association represents the migrant education Program(s) that a Student participates in or receives services from. The association is an extension of the StudentProgramAssociation with added elements particular to migrant education Programs.

tags.name: StudentNeglectedOrDelinquentProgramAssociations
tags.description: This association represents the Title I Part D Neglected or Delinquent Program(s) that a Student participates in or from which the Student receives services.

tags.name: StudentParentAssociations
tags.description: This association relates Students to their Parents, guardians, or caretakers.

tags.name: StudentProgramAssociations
tags.description: This association represents the Program(s) that a Student participates in or is served by.

tags.name: StudentProgramAttendanceEvents
tags.description: This event entity represents the recording of whether a Student is in attendance to receive or participate in Program services.

tags.name: Students
tags.description: This entity represents an individual for whom instruction, services, and/or care are provided in an early childhood, elementary, or secondary educational Program under the jurisdiction of a School, education agency or other institution or Program. A Student is a person who has been enrolled in a School or other educational institution.

tags.name: StudentSchoolAssociations
tags.description: This association represents the School in which a Student is enrolled. The semantics of enrollment may differ slightly by state. Non-enrollment relationships between a Student and an education organization may be described using the StudentEducationOrganizationAssociation.

tags.name: StudentSchoolAttendanceEvents
tags.description: This event entity represents the recording of whether a Student is in attendance for a School day.

tags.name: StudentSchoolFoodServiceProgramAssociations
tags.description: This association represents the School food services Program(s), such as the Free or Reduced Lunch Program, that a Student participates in or from which the Student receives services.

tags.name: StudentSectionAssociations
tags.description: This association indicates the Course Sections to which a Student is assigned.

tags.name: StudentSectionAttendanceEvents
tags.description: This event entity represents the recording of whether a Student is in attendance for a Section.

tags.name: StudentSpecialEducationProgramAssociations
tags.description: This association represents the special education Program(s) that a Student participates in or receives services from. The association is an extension of the StudentProgramAssociation particular for special education Programs.

tags.name: StudentTitleIPartAProgramAssociations
tags.description: This association represents the Title I Part A Program(s) that a Student participates in or from which the Student receives services. The association is an extension of the StudentProgramAssociation particular for Title I Part A Programs.
